course_title: Western Art Music 1700-1900: Approaches and Concepts

learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate an overall grasp of major developments in Western art music of the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries, including changes in musical styles and social contexts;
Demonstrate critical insight into specific case studies of music in terms of stylistic and aesthetic factors and social contexts;
Work effectively with the materials of music (scores, sound recordings etc.) in order to make informed critical judgements;
Apply bibliographic and research skills to specific problems or questions related to course content; and
Communicate effectively in appropriate ways on various topics, questions, issue in relation to the course content.

assessments.task_description: This assessment task gives you the opportunity to demonstrate a range of foundational skills in locating, selecting, evaluating, and referencing source materials for music research. Task specifics are set in week one. You will be able use this work and feedback on it in preparation for the Critical Writing assessment task. These two assessment components are linked.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: You are required to write an essay on one of a range of available topics. Task-specific details are set in the early part of the semester. The work provides you with an opportunity to demonstrate relevant specific knowledge, critical insight, engagement with appropriate research materials, understanding of conventions of academic style (including referencing and citation), and clarity of communication.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: You are required to sit a final examination covering course content from weeks 4 to 13. The examination format is multiple-choice.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.weighting: <dd>10% Each quiz is worth equal weight </dd>
assessments.due_date:
Week 6, Mon 5:00 pm

Week 8, Mon 5:00 pm

Week 12, Mon 5:00 pm

Week 13, Fri 5:00 pm
assessments.task_description: Four regularly spaced short quizzes to be completed in student's own time within set periods (selected Mondays/Fridays between 9.00am and 9.00pm). These will comprise multiple-choice questions related to lecture content leading up to the time of the quiz (generally, the two lectures prior).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

learning_activities.topic:
Course Introduction

Introduction to the course: overview of content, assessment, and so on.


Learning outcomes: L01
learning_activities.topic_description: Course Introduction Introduction to the course: overview of content, assessment, and so on.

learning_activities.topic:
Historical Overview

This lecture provides a broad overview of the two centuries from 1700 to 1900, setting out a framework of major developments across Europe both in musical and other terms.


Learning outcomes: L01
learning_activities.topic_description: Historical Overview This lecture provides a broad overview of the two centuries from 1700 to 1900, setting out a framework of major developments across Europe both in musical and other terms.

learning_activities.topic:
Music Research Foundations

This and next week's tutorial concentrate on developing foundational skills and knowledge for successful music research.


Learning outcomes: L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Music Research Foundations This and next week's tutorial concentrate on developing foundational skills and knowledge for successful music research.

learning_activities.topic:
Resources for Music Research

This lecture introduces a range of research tools available through the library as well as explaining key concepts around the early stages of music research that are relevant to the first assessment (Music Research Foundations).                           


Learning outcomes: L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Resources for Music Research This lecture introduces a range of research tools available through the library as well as explaining key concepts around the early stages of music research that are relevant to the first assessment (Music Research Foundations).

learning_activities.topic:
Music Research Foundations

Continues from week 2.


Learning outcomes: L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Music Research Foundations Continues from week 2.

learning_activities.topic:
Instrumental Music in the Late Baroque Period

Considers instrumental music in c. 1700-1750, styles and contexts, including, amongst others, the sonatas and concertos of Corelli and Vivaldi, French keyboard music, North German organ works, and J. S. Bach's instrumental music.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_title: Instrumental Music in the Late Baroque Period
learning_activities.topic_description: Instrumental Music in the Late Baroque Period Considers instrumental music in c. 1700-1750, styles and contexts, including, amongst others, the sonatas and concertos of Corelli and Vivaldi, French keyboard music, North German organ works, and J. S. Bach's instrumental music.

learning_activities.topic:
Bach, Brandenburg Concerto No. 5

Focus on Bach's 5th Brandenburg Concerto and related readings. Topics include Bach's adaptation of the Baroque concerto form, as well political interpretation of the concerto's unique form.


Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Bach, Brandenburg Concerto No. 5 Focus on Bach's 5th Brandenburg Concerto and related readings. Topics include Bach's adaptation of the Baroque concerto form, as well political interpretation of the concerto's unique form.

learning_activities.topic:
Vocal Music in the Late Baroque Period

Considers various types of vocal styles and their contexts in music c. 1700-1750. Includes: Italian opera, Lutheran church music, and English oratorio.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_title: Vocal Music in the Late Baroque Period
learning_activities.topic_description: Vocal Music in the Late Baroque Period Considers various types of vocal styles and their contexts in music c. 1700-1750. Includes: Italian opera, Lutheran church music, and English oratorio.

learning_activities.topic:
Bach, Brandenburg Concerto No. 5 (continued)

Continues from week 4.


Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Bach, Brandenburg Concerto No. 5 (continued) Continues from week 4.

learning_activities.topic:
Vocal Music in the Classical Period

Considers vocal music, primarily opera, in the second half of the 18th century. This includes the emergence and development of opera buffa, the reforms of Gluck, and the operas of Mozart.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Vocal Music in the Classical Period Considers vocal music, primarily opera, in the second half of the 18th century. This includes the emergence and development of opera buffa , the reforms of Gluck, and the operas of Mozart.

learning_activities.topic:
Mozart, Don Giovanni

Focus on late-Classical opera buffa through the excerpts from Mozart's Don Giovanni. Issues include conventions of opera buffa, Mozart's use of dance-based music as a system of social signification, issues of gender politics in music

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Mozart, Don Giovanni Focus on late-Classical opera buffa through the excerpts from Mozart's Don Giovanni . Issues include conventions of opera buffa , Mozart's use of dance-based music as a system of social signification, issues of gender politics in music

learning_activities.topic:
Instrumental Music in the Classical period

Considers instrumental genres in the second half of the eighteenth century, including keyboard sonatas, the emergence of the string quartet and the maturation of the classical symphony.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Instrumental Music in the Classical period Considers instrumental genres in the second half of the eighteenth century, including keyboard sonatas, the emergence of the string quartet and the maturation of the classical symphony.

learning_activities.topic:
Mozart, Don Giovanni (continued)

Continues from week 6.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Mozart, Don Giovanni (continued) Continues from week 6.

learning_activities.topic:
Vocal Music in the Early Romantic Period

Considers two contrasting styles of vocal music in the early Romantic period (c. 1815-1850): Italian opera and the German Lied. Also briefly covers the emergence of German Romantic opera and the phenomenon of French grand opera.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_title: Vocal Music in the Early Romantic Period
learning_activities.topic_description: Vocal Music in the Early Romantic Period Considers two contrasting styles of vocal music in the early Romantic period (c. 1815-1850): Italian opera and the German Lied . Also briefly covers the emergence of German Romantic opera and the phenomenon of French grand opera.

learning_activities.topic:
Instrumental Music in the Early Romantic Period

Considers instrumental genres and forms of the early Romantic period. Includes piano music for the home, the cult of the virtuoso, formal innovations, and developments in symphonic music after Beethoven.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_title: Instrumental Music in the Early Romantic Period
learning_activities.topic_description: Instrumental Music in the Early Romantic Period Considers instrumental genres and forms of the early Romantic period. Includes piano music for the home, the cult of the virtuoso, formal innovations, and developments in symphonic music after Beethoven.

learning_activities.topic:
Clara Schumann, Three Songs from Liebesfrühling Lieder, op. 12.

Considers early Romantic lieder with focus on selected songs by Clara Schumann from the Liebesfrühling Lieder, op. 12.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_title: Clara Schumann, Three Songs from Liebesfrühling Lieder, op. 12.
learning_activities.topic_description: Clara Schumann, Three Songs from Liebesfrühling Lieder, op. 12. Considers early Romantic lieder with focus on selected songs by Clara Schumann from the Liebesfrühling Lieder , op. 12.

learning_activities.topic:
Vocal Music in the late Romantic period

Considers the development of opera and the distinctive paths seen in the works of Wagner and Verdi. Also considers other particular developments in opera and Lieder

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_title: Vocal Music in the late Romantic period
learning_activities.topic_description: Vocal Music in the late Romantic period Considers the development of opera and the distinctive paths seen in the works of Wagner and Verdi. Also considers other particular developments in opera and Lieder

learning_activities.topic:
Clara Schumann, Three Songs from Liebesfrühling Lieder, op. 12.

Continues from week 8.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_title: Clara Schumann, Three Songs from Liebesfrühling Lieder, op. 12.
learning_activities.topic_description: Clara Schumann, Three Songs from Liebesfrühling Lieder, op. 12. Continues from week 8.

learning_activities.topic:
Instrumental Music in the late Romantic period

Considers the later developments of instrumental music (in particular symphonic music), including the symphonies or Brahms and the program music of Liszt and Strauss.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_title: Instrumental Music in the late Romantic period
learning_activities.topic_description: Instrumental Music in the late Romantic period Considers the later developments of instrumental music (in particular symphonic music), including the symphonies or Brahms and the program music of Liszt and Strauss.

learning_activities.topic:
R. Strauss, Don Juan

Considers late Romantic symphonic music through Strauss's tone poem, Don Juan. Issues considered include program music, changes to sonata procedure, gender representations in music (c.f. Mozart)

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: R. Strauss, Don Juan Considers late Romantic symphonic music through Strauss's tone poem, Don Juan. Issues considered include program music, changes to sonata procedure, gender representations in music (c.f. Mozart)

learning_activities.topic:
Course conclusion

Course wrap up and advice and activities for exam preparation.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Course conclusion Course wrap up and advice and activities for exam preparation.

R. Strauss, Don Juan

Continues from week 12.
